thread.title: H.S. football: Aveon Irving runs wild for Garfield - Sports
thread.title_full: H.S. football: Aveon Irving runs wild for Garfield - Sports - NorthJersey.com

author: ED MILLS
title: H.S. football: Aveon Irving runs wild for Garfield - Sports
text:
Buy this photo JIM ALCORN/SPECIAL TO THE RECORD Garfield’s Aveon Irving had four touchdowns on the ground in Friday’s win over Waldwick/Midland Park. GARFIELD – Aveon Irving and the rest of his Garfield offense enjoyed a big, big night Friday.
A senior running back, Irving scored four touchdowns on the ground and rushed for 262 yards on 17 carries to help Garfield defeat Waldwick/Midland Park, 50-43, in an NJIC Colonial Division game at Arthur Argauer Stadium. Garfield raised its record to 5-1, 4-0 in the Colonial and Waldwick/Midland Park is now 4-2 and 3-1.
Also having a big evening for the Boilermakers were senior wide receiver Steven Nolasco (one touchdown reception and one interception returned for a touchdown), senior quarterback Alex Victorino (9-for-12 passing for 171 yards, one touchdown pass, two two-point conversion passes) and senior running back Tyler Montanye (8 carries for 51 yards, one touchdown).
Defensively, Nolasco, Irving and Anthony Barksdale hadone interception apiece for the Boilermakers. Matthew DeLorenzo had a fumble recovery.
The Boilermakers had over 450 yards in total offense and Waldwick/Midland Park had over 300 yards, led by junior quarterback Garrett King, who rushed for 108 yards on 12 carries with two touchdowns and also threw a touchdown pass.
Irving scored on a 90-yard touchdown ramble to give Garfield a 44-19 lead with 4:38 left in the third quarter. His 8-yard touchdown run with 4:03 left in the game gave Garfield a 50-35 advantage before Waldwick/Midland Park scored a touchdown with 2:28 left to make it 50-43.
The first time Garfield got the ball following the opening kickoff, the Boilermakers marched 64 yards in five plays, highlighted by a 54-yard pass from Victorino to Nolasco. That led to Montanye’s 1-yard touchdown run 2:04 into the game.
Waldwick/Midland Park answered with a 68-yard, eight-play touchdown drive of its own. Senior Brett Calderone scored from 13 yards away and James Kennedy made the extra point kick to give the Warriors a 7-6 advantage 5:33 into the first quarter.
But Garfield came right back with a quick 65-yard, two-play thrust of its own, scoring on a 55-yard touchdown pass from Victorino to Nolasco. Victorino’s successful two-point conversion pass to Nolasco gave Garfield a 14-7 lead with 5:34 left in the opening period.
Again, Waldwick/Midland Park answered with a 73-yard, 9-play drive of its own, keyed by a 21-yard ramble by Sonny DiPasquale and a 15-yard gain by junior quarterback Garrett King.
King plunged 1 yard for the touchdown that pulled the Warriors within 14-13 with two minutes left in the first quarter.
It was in the second quarter when Garfield started to pull away. A 1-yard touchdown run by Irving capped a 70-yard, six-play touchdown march and Victorino’s two-point conversion pass to Anthony Barksdale made it 22-13 with 3:35 left in the half.
DiPasquale’s 4-yard touchdown burst with 2:09 left before the break to end a 68-yard, 7-play drive pulled Waldwick/Midland Park within 22-19.
But Garfield got two touchdowns in a row in the final two minutes of the half to extend the lead. First came an electrifying 74-yard touchdown run by Irving, and when Victorino found DeLorenzo with the two-point conversion pass it was 30-19 Garfield with 1:47 remaining until intermission.
Nolasco’s 85-yard interception return came with 51 seconds left in the half and Montanye’s two-point conversion run made it 38-19 for Garfield at halftime.
